title: Student Technology Consultant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UW Bothell
Interview Descriptions: I applied the position online and sent my resume. After a couple weeks, I received an email invitation to schedule an in person interview. The interview consisted of more than 10 behavioral and hypothetical situational questions and took about 45 minutes.
Interview Questions: Situational questions like, What if this was happen, or Someone came to you with this issue and need help in x amount of time.

title: Resident Advisor (RA) Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UW Bothell
Interview Descriptions: group interview where they put you in random teams and you need to discuss a topic or perform a task, then you're interviewed by 3 or 4 people in individual rotating sessions, then it's the job offer
Interview Questions: What is your customer service experience?

title: Student Club Council Chair Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UW Bothell in Dec 2021
Interview Descriptions: The process was just talking about your experiences. And why you want the role. It was easy. Just make sure you are confident and believe in great values to be able to help the student body with club stuff.
Interview Questions: Why do you want the job?

title: CRM Specialist Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UW Bothell
Interview Descriptions: First I had a phone interview. I think after two weeks, I got the virtual interview.  It was a panel interview for half an hour. Four people asked me questions.
Interview Questions: What do you do for fun?

title: Admissions Counselor Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UW Bothell
Interview Descriptions: First i had a Phone Interview, then in person interview, project based presentation. Straight forward no games or gimmicks . very nice people, who just want to add genuine people to the team.
Interview Questions: How have you worked with Diversity?

title: ARC Fitness Center Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 3 weeks. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in Aug 2021
Interview Descriptions: We interviewed through zoom. Asked some questions about why are you interested in this job, what is a successful communication, and talked about some job duties. The process is relaxed and very easy.
Interview Questions: why are you interested in this job

title: Marketing Coordinator Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 5 days. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in Sept 2019
Interview Descriptions: The interview process consisted of 30 minute interview with the hiring manager. Most of the questions in the interview were about diversity and inclusion. The position didn't require any previous experience, however, it required a very good understanding of the position responsibilities, and what would you bring to the team.
Interview Questions: Who is your role model?

title: Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UW Bothell in Jun 2019
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview process. The majority of the screening occurred online.  Be prepared to follow up with the professors directly to demonstrate initiative. They asked about grades and completed courses. I graded for three courses at once with a 10 hour/week allotment for all three.
Interview Questions: The STEM office was a little slow at sending notifications. Emailing the professor directly was key to staying informed.

title: Undergraduate Teaching Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in Sept 2018
Interview Descriptions: Met with the program supervisor, fellow teaching assistant, and a professor. Most of the interview was pleasant conversation and walkthrough of a problem. I would defiantly recommend and really appreciated the hiring process.
Interview Questions: How do you explain simple trigonometric functions?

title: Student Engagement & Activities Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in May 2018
Interview Descriptions:
First, they will screen some unnecessary applicants an email to set up interviews. It is a really friendly interview process and asks simple behavioral questions, i.e they will give you a scenario.
Be calm and be yourself. Don't take more than 4-5 minutes to answer a question, unless you have a very good and exciting example with an anecdote.
If you had prior contact with the interviewers and they know you by name, it will help a lot.
Interview Questions: What does social justice mean to you?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in Sept 2017
Interview Descriptions: Brief, they give you a sheet of questions that you can read while interviewing that they ask you about. Kind of odd but beneficial if you need a prompt. Two on one for the on-site interview. Very casual and they are aware they are interviewing students.
Interview Questions: Have you worked with any video or audio editing software before?

title: Student Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UW Bothell
Interview Descriptions: The interviews are usually panel, depending on where you apply.  Other more experienced student workers might be present. I would suggest going to the career center first on-campus before going through the application.
Interview Questions: What is your definition of Diversity?

title: Assistant Professor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 days. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA)
Interview Descriptions: It was amicable and friendly process. It lasted 2. days with a lot of rounds. Everyone was super nice and welcoming. The presentations were well received and though provoking questions were asked. Overall great experience.
Interview Questions: How would you use your research expertise in teaching practices.

title: Researcher Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. I interviewed at UW Bothell
Interview Descriptions: Overall, it was a 1:1 interview with questions on what I have worked on before and what I am interested to work on the project. Friendly and behavioral based questions. They generally want to align your expectations and goals with your responsibilities, so make sure you know what you want.
Interview Questions: Where do you see yourself? What do you want to specialize in?

title: STEM Grader Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UW Bothell
Interview Descriptions: There was no interview. I asked a professor whom I had a class with if he needed a grader so I could keep in touch with him and the area of study (since it was different from my major). There is typically an interview, though, and you need to have had at least a 3.5 in the class you're applying to grade for.
Interview Questions: What is your schedule like? How many hours a week do you need/want? Are you a work-study student?

title: Intercultural Coordinators Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in Jan 2015
Interview Descriptions: the interview was 30 min total and there was 10 questions. Most of them were very general such as "why you want this job" "tell me about your self" type questions. There was couple hard one such as diversity related question and campus community building. make sure to have some idea or opinion on diversity, gender equality and intercultural communication before the interview and ready to talk about it. The interview process is relatively slow.
Interview Questions: Tell me about your strength ?

title: Student Technician Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in Sept 2014
Interview Descriptions: I submitted a resume and cover letter and received a call back within a few days.  The interview took place a few days later and then maybe a week after that I got an offer.
Interview Questions: N/A

title: Program Manager Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in May 2014
Interview Descriptions: I was invited to participate in a phone interview, then was asked to come to campus for a panel interview, then a final interview with the Director. The position was offered to me approximately one month after I applied
Interview Questions: Pretty standard interview questions.

title: Exam Proctor Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UW Bothell
Interview Descriptions: Will ask questions about relevant customer service experience, strengths and weaknesses, and a few questions about how you keep yourself organized. The hiring process is pretty simple, and once a position opens up, sometimes at the end of a quarter they will be hiring.
Interview Questions: What do you think will be the most difficult part of this job? Research this job a little to answer this question.

title: Academic Affairs Advising Interview
Application Type: I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in Feb 2014
Interview Descriptions: The process was wonderful full of smiling faces that were very very supportive. They asked questionings revolving what we envisioned the school. What we saw happening. As well as personal evaluations.
Interview Questions: Questions ranged from tell about yourself to why do you want this job? How does your friends describe you in three words?

title: Faculty Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 4 weeks. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA)
Interview Descriptions: Phone interview with search committee followed by campus visit - pretty typical.
Interview Questions: Why do you want to come to Bothell?

title: Student Web Assistant Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in Dec 2013
Interview Descriptions:
Dropped resume off to the person listed on the job description. Had to follow up somewhat aggressively only to discover my resume never made it to the potential boss. Sent it directly to them.

Interview was simple. Just some simple HTML/CSS questions to make sure you understand web languages.
Interview Questions:
How do you add a link to an image using HTML?
What is the proper way to add style to text?

title: Tutor Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at UW Bothell (Bothell, WA) in Jun 2011
Interview Descriptions: Prepare a problem and explain it in a mock tutoring session.
Interview Questions: After mock tutoring, I was asked 'What would you do differently if this were a real tutoring session?".
